WorkItem.Description:
I spotted something very strange (at least to me) in the Druide Tree model. It values "Redeemer's Alchemist Stone" (SP: 63; 40%+ on selfused potions) higher than "The Egg of Mortal Essence" (SP: 98; proc 505 Haste). Even if you ignore the chance for haste proc (which happens quite often for me) I can not understand how the +35 Spellpower would not make the Egg more preferable. Especially since you can use potions only once during a boss fight. I tried all different "Spell Usage" under Figth details, but doesnt make a difference in Rawr's preference for the stone.
 
Is this a flaw in the model or in my understanding.

Comments.Message: Are you going OOM? Do you have buffs all filled out?

I rarely going OOM; only in really lengthy boss fights; all the raid buffs are set (to the best of my knowledge) so I really don't understand how the alchemist stone would help me more doing more/longer healing. thats why I assume that maybe the valuation/calc in the background might be incorrect for the resto druid.

Maybe this helps:

the model assumes you are using every opportunity to cast and that you're having no latency problems. The default fight length is 5 minutes, which you will only have in raids. The default rotation is chaincasting regrowth on a different players while keeping up rejuv and lifebloom on 1 tank.

Obviously, in many fights we don't chaincast. Sometimes there's heavy healing. Often, we just keep that lifebloom up on the tank when there is enough healing. What do you think, if you would be chaincasting your heals all the time, would you go out of mana? (I think I would)

The best way to deal with this issue right now is changing the length of the fight (make it much shorter so you won't go out of mana according to the calculation)

I'm considering adding a slider bar that can let you lower the time% spent casting the primary heal outside refreshing tank hots.
Oh, and before I forget it.... you can play with the Burst vs Sustained slider; if you make Burst more important, then the Egg is much bettah =)

Ah, I've added a slider bar (if you set it to 0%, your primary heal will not be cast, if to 50% you spend half your "free" time spending your primary heal, if to 100%, you will cast your primary heal 100% of the time outside refreshing hots)

And I've added a self innervate option. Have fun with it.

Thanks Trolando. 
The slider bar for free time is much appreciated. Being told I am going to go OOM in less than 2 minutes, always upset me, since I tend to end many fights with nearly full mana (or an unused innervate) due to hanging back and only casting when neccesary.
